column2: Technical Accounting                       Learn about emerging accounting issues that may impact MetLife s reporting obligations under both GAAP and Statutory requirements.                     Research technical accounting issues and accounting policy/procedure matters. Interpret and project the financial impact on US Operations, both on a GAAP and a statutory basis.                     Prepare position papers presenting the Technical Accounting Group s interpretation of the issues, application of appropriate guidance and conclusion on the accounting treatment.                     Stay abreast of new accounting changes/developments. Analyze technical pronouncements and ask questions to gain an understanding. Evaluate and effectively communicate implications for MetLife of the proposed issue. Assist with implementation of new accounting pronouncements.                     Working with the business on preparation of accounting reporting US GAAP schedules and other back up supporting requirements.                       Customer Focus and Partnership                       Partner with various units (Financial Reporting, Expenses, etc) in order to understand the accounting issues.                     Provide timely and accurate guidance/assistance in evaluating accounting treatment/processes/procedures to various groups within the business.                     Build relationship with Corporate Technical Accounting Service Unit (TASU) and TAG members from other business units. Work collectively with various groups to resolve complex issues.                       Time/Project Management                       Prioritize and focus to meet customer expectations and project deadlines.                     Work under constant changing environment.                     Manage multiple tasks to ensure all deliverables are completed by due dates.

column2: Essential Duties and Responsibilities    include the following. Other duties may be assigned.       The Technical Account Manager is responsible for Account Management of a portfolio of clients across globe and covering specific region.         Responsible for being an internal part of the Account Team, partnering with Sales and Pre-Sales.         coordinates work with cross-functional teams internally as well as third party suppliers.         Management and development of geographically dispersed Team members.         Participate in the RFP/RFQ, Offer Management and Renewal process.         Manage Customer communications.         Escalate issues not getting resolved at the working level.         Conduct Business reviews with customer and continuously engage to make sure the customer is aware of new features and Roadmap.         Monitor usage of system and engage with the customer as required if any anomalies are noticed.         Actively manage the Project process through implementation planning, scheduling, and execution of the solution implementation.         Advise Client Project Managers regarding Project status and Operational Implementation.         Utilize PMI recognized Best Practices in Scope, Time, Resource, Quality, Risk, Cost Communications Management.         Perform tasks such as Revenue Forecasting and Tracking, Resource Allocations, Billing and Collections.         Ensure Project tasks are completed within deadlines.         Communicate status and resolution of issues with clients, Senior Management, and Internal Team Members.         Manage Client relationship through face-to-face meetings and conference calls.         Improve Team performance by building Team cohesiveness, leading, mentoring, training, and motivating to facilitate cooperation, ensuring project efficiency and boosting morale.         Identify and resolve issues by partnering with client, vendor, and internal groups.         Competencies/ Skills:       To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:       Management of 3 - 4 (small to medium) Projects simultaneously.         Proficiency in Microsoft Suite, especially MS Project and SharePoint and other MS Office tools         Strong Organizational, Negotiation and Influencing skills         Basic Telephony knowledge.         Specialization in Rating, Routing Billing systems is a plus.         Willingness to travel 30% to 50% of the time, including International travel.         Qualifications and Experience:         Bachelor s Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science or IT-related discipline is preferred.         PMP Certification is a plus         Telecom experience is a plus.         7-10 years Project Management experience in high-tech systems implementation, managing projects from inception to completion with at least 5 years of supervisory experience         Language Skills          Must have excellent Oral and Written Communication skills in English.         Foreign language speaking skills highly desired.

column2: The Assistant Manager / Manager Billing & Estimation is responsible for overseeing the billing and estimation processes within the organization     This role involves preparing accurate project cost estimates, managing billing activities, and ensuring timely invoicing to clients     The individual in this position will work closely with project managers, sales teams, and clients to ensure billing and estimation processes align with project requirements and organizational standards     Key Responsibilities: Estimation:Prepare detailed and accurate cost estimates for projects based on project requirements, materials, labor, and overhead costs     Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to gather necessary information for creating precise estimates     Analyze project specifications and blueprints to understand project scope and requirements     Stay updated with industry pricing trends, material costs, and labor rates to ensure competitiveness and accuracy in estimates     Review and refine estimates as necessary, ensuring they align with the organizations profit margins and pricing strategies     Billing:Develop and maintain billing procedures and guidelines to ensure consistency and accuracy in the billing process     Generate invoices and statements accurately and in a timely manner     Verify billing data to ensure completeness and correctness, resolving any discrepancies with clients or internal teams     Coordinate with project managers and clients to resolve billing-related queries and concerns     Monitor accounts receivable and follow up on overdue payments, working closely with the finance department     Documentation and Reporting:Maintain detailed records of estimates, invoices, and billing communications for future reference and auditing purposes     Prepare regular reports on billing and estimation activities, providing insights into key performance indicators (KPIs) to management     Assist in financial reporting by providing accurate billing and revenue data to the finance department     Process Improvement:Identify areas for process improvement in billing and estimation procedures     Implement best practices to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and customer satisfaction     Stay informed about industry standards and emerging trends related to billing and estimation processes     Collaboration and Communication:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including project management, sales, and finance, to ensure seamless project execution and billing processes     Communicate effectively with clients, addressing their billing inquiries and concerns professionally and promptly     Foster positive relationships with clients, promoting customer satisfaction and retention     Qualifications:Bachelors degree in a related field (such as Accounting, Finance, or Engineering)     Proven experience in billing and estimation roles, preferably in a construction, engineering, or similar industry     Strong analytical skills and attention to detail     Proficiency in using billing and estimation software/tools     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills     Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment     Knowledge of relevant legal and regulatory requirements related to billing and contracts

column2: Role & responsibilities     Leading complete Finance & Accounts for Plant/Plants. Monitoring Accounts receivable, collections, ageing, MIS. Monitor Accounts Payable, payments, ageing, MSME, MIS. Preparation of financial statements including Balance sheet, P&L, cashflow on quarterly basis. Preparing schedules and annexures of financials required time to time. Responsible for Indirect statutory .compliances including GST reco, timely assessment, filing returns. Determining Income tax, calculations, Tax audit, preparing computation and ITR. Ensuring the issuance of timely Bank Guarantees, EMS deposits, other requirements of customer, monitoring, tracking and timely release of the same from customer. Getting audits of company accounts through External and Internal auditors and settling of queries.  Coordination with Internal & Statutory Auditor & Compliance of Audit Report. Preparing Annual budgets and monthly variance analysis incl but not limited to RM reco, consumptions, Scarp, stores, All expenses etc. Monitoring the Cash Flow of funds, preparing MIS, taking adequate measures to ensure optimum utilization of available funds towards the accomplishment of organizational objectives. Liaising with banks and financial institutions for day to day operations and effective utilization of limits. Preparing foreign remittances with banks and Statutory compliance.  Monitoring retirement of import documents, attestation of invoices, scrutiny and filing of bill of entry. Handling Capex and project management. Functional Knowledge & Skills Required Having knowledge of general accounting principles and Accounts standards. Knowledge of treasury and experience of MIS, Balance sheet preparation, Direct tax, Indirect tax, Treasury. Leadership quality to manage the team and handle senior team members.  Qualification CA, ICWA,CA-Inter, MBA with relevant experience

column1: Senior Manager - Record To Report (17+ years)
column2: Senior Manager - Record To Report (17+ years) Exciting leadership opportunity available within a prestigious global organization. This role entails serving as  the Global Service Delivery Lead for Finance Operations across Record to Report Domain . The ideal candidate will be delivering a financial management solution including a flexible accounting structure,  comprehensive journal processing , and reporting as well as the management of  commitments and expenditures . If you're a skilled leader seeking a new career challenge, this position could be the perfect fit for you! Location - Bangalore Your Future Employer:  Join a dynamic organization committed to diversity and female empowerment, operational excellence, and continuous growth. You will collaborate with senior management, leveraging your financial expertise to drive transformative change across diverse transactions and geographies. Responsibilities: Analyzing operational data and financial reports to drive financial outcomes, including transaction reconciliation. Creating journal entries, conducting balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, generating cash forecasting statements, facilitating month-end closing procedures, compiling reports, and providing audit support. Accountable for providing a robust financial management solution encompassing a customizable accounting framework, extensive journal processing capabilities, hierarchical summaries, user-friendly inquiry and reporting functionalities, dynamic allocations, and effective management of commitments and expenditures Supporting various stages of client engagements, from diagnostics and due diligence to transformation initiatives and ongoing portfolio management. Utilizing cutting-edge digital finance and accounting technologies, automation, AI, and analytics to drive efficiency and innovation. Identifying and addressing potential risks for clients and stakeholders, and implementing proactive action plans. Managing and leading medium to large-sized teams or work efforts both at client sites and within the organization. Requirements: Qualified CA  with minimum 17+ years of professional experience. Senior Delivery Lead with mandatory expertise across  Record to Report R2R  with tech background driving transformation, innovation, and other initiatives. Proven track record in Global Service Delivery, Finance Operations, and Client Management. Extensive experience in third-party services, Process Re-engineering, and Transition Management. Demonstrated ability in managing large teams, with experience handling 250-600 FTEs. Full-time office-based role. Flexibility to work across different shifts as required. What's in it for You: Opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects, influencing the financial landscape of the organization. Exposure to senior management and collaboration across various geographies, enhancing your professional network. Competitive compensation package and benefits, including opportunities for career advancement and skill development in a female-empowered environment. Reach us:  If you think this role is aligned with your career, kindly write me an email along with your updated CV on  radhika.agrawal@crescendogroup.in  for a confidential discussion on the role. Disclaimer:  Crescendo Global is specializes in Senior to C-level niche recruitment. We are passionate about empowering job seekers and employers with an engaging memorable job search and leadership hiring experience. Crescendo Global does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. Note : We receive a lot of applications on a daily basis so it becomes a bit difficult for us to get back to each candidate. Please assume that your profile has not been shortlisted in case you don't hear back from us in 1 week. Your patience is highly appreciated. Keywords- Finance Operations, F&A towers, R2R, Record to Report, RTR, journal entries, balance sheet reconciliations, reconciliations, cash forecasting statements, month-end closing, compiling reports, audit.

column2: Dear Candidate, Warm Greetings from Vadilal Industries Limited! With reference to your CV available at a Job Portal, we would like to take an opportunity of exploring your association with our company, Vadilal Industries Limited. About Vadilal Industries Ltd.: Vadilal, as the name conjures images of lip-smacking ice cream in a whole gamut of flavours.VADILAL GROUP is highly diversified and has presence in Ice Creams, Processed Foods , Forex, Construction etc. For more details about the group and specific Group Companies please visit our website at www.vadilalgroup.com Vadilal is the third largest company in India for manufacturing ice-cream, with a production capacity 3.25 lacs litres per day. Vadilal spells quality, availability, variety and state-of-the-art machinery and equipment. It has, however, been a long journey for the group, which traces its origins way back to 1907. We have an opportunity for  "Manager / Sr. Manager_Accounts"  at  Ahmedabad  Location.   Qualification:   Chartered Accountant  with (1st time passes desirable), and MBA is preferred Experience   :    8 - 12 years post qualification experience Technology :  SAP S4 HANA, BOTS, Power BI, RPA, SAC Job Responsibilities:  Drive  the Financial Reporting and Accounting Process thru Technology To  achieve design optimisation and digitised Finance processes enabled by key      platforms/technologies: Order-to-Cash  (O2C), including contract & order management, billing &  collections, and deductions & dispute management, cash management and  reconciliations etc. Purchase-to-Pay  (P2P), including contract and purchasing order management, receiving       goods & services, invoice management, payment and travel &  expenses etc. Acquire-to-Retire (A2R), including project accounting, capitalization, fixed asset       management, depreciation and other fixed asset transactions etc. Record-to-Report (R2R), including master data management, general accounting, close       management, consolidation, external reporting, intercompany accounting and chart of accounts design etc. Conduct fit-gap analysis for Finance technology and business processes and develop a roadmap with recommendations based on the finance process requirements. Identify business requirements and conduct vendor assessment and selection. To  impart training to end users and facilitate for UAT. Candidate should be ready to sign a bond. Skill Set: Previous  experience in a finance transformation, digital finance projects and/or designing or delivering large-scale transformation through ERP / RPA / BI      (8+ years of experience in industry/consulting) Demonstrates  familiarity with key finance technologies and data, including cloud ERP      platforms such as SAP S4 HANA, ARIBA, BPC, GRE, SAC, BI Practical knowledge of the latest technologies (Artificial Intelligence, Robotic Process Automation and Analytics) and the application of these in a  finance context Experience in design thinking/agile project delivery methods Highly credible with the ability to engage broadly with all levels of management,      on personal and professional attributes. Strong  analytical skills, understanding of complex issues, the ability to quickly absorb information, conceptual and creative problem-solving excellence. Extremelystrong collaboration, planning, influencing, prioritisation and time management skills Driven; enjoys a challenge, proven ability to adapt and remove obstacles to achieve results, determination, and optimism. Relevant  knowledge and understandings of various compliance and disclosure      requirements under Indian Accounting Standard (Ind AS), Company Law, SEBI LODR, Tax laws and other statutory requirements.   Interested candidates can send their resume on below email id: rohinimhadnak@vadilalgroup.com
column11: Process Automation, SAP, Artificial Intelligence, Robotic Process Automation, Order To Cash, Procure To Pay, finance

column2: Position Summary                                     Particular focus of the role involves supporting more senior actuaries who (are):                         Responsible for the production of USGAAP and Local Statutory (IFRS 4) valuations for a number of countries within MetLife                          Takes the results of models run centrally and submits these results to the USGAAP ledger as part of a controlled process;                          Explain results to the USGAAP Reporting manager (including analysis of movement in reserves, intangibles in the Income statement)                          Drive improvement in processes (automation, simplification), figure out any relevant issues from Actuarial standpoint and deliver the solution                          Support in specification and validation of new valuation methodologies, models and product implementations;                          Support additional financial research, governance, controls, actuarial methods and standards used within assigned sub-region;                          Develop strong working relationships and strategic partnerships with internal clients to ensure a high degree of customer satisfaction;                          Assist Actuarial Team Leader to support the USGAAP Reporting Manager and ensure critical focus on core deliverables throughout the course of the reporting year                                        Job Responsibilities                                         To support the delivery of the following objectives:                                           USGAAP                                 Timely and accurate delivery of the Actuarial elements of the USGAAP and local statutory balance sheet and P&L                                  Timely and accurate analysis of USGAAP and local statutory results;                                  Explanation of variance between reported results and previous plans;                                  Liaison with Financial Controllers to ensure suitable and consistent reserving and accounting practices;                                  Assistance to the senior management team in the continuous monitoring of the USGAAP process, including the impact of assumption updates and implementation of new products.                                  Execution of SoX controls and other sign offs as required.                                  Interaction with Internal and External Auditors as required.                                  Error free, clear communication of results via reporting templates, memos, reports or presentations.                                    Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) of Position:                                   Error free preparation of financial reports to required timescales and relevant actuarial standards;                                  Execution of second-line data validation and completeness checks to required actuarial and audit standards.                                  Contributing towards good team morale and positive team engagement and professional development.                                  Ensuring excellent communication between Noida-based team and stakeholders based in different geographical locations.                                Taking demonstrable ownership of work; clearly flagging any issues and goal delivery concerns to senor leadership team.                              Knowledge, Skills and Abilities                                       Education                       A bachelors or masters university degree with a heavy mathematical focus (e.g. mathematics, engineering, physics, computer science, financial economics - these are examples only)                                 Experience                       5 -7 years of actuarial experience.                                     Knowledge and skills        (general and technical)                       Essential experience, skills and competencies:                             Meticulous in the validation, presentation and communication of results;                          Respectful of deadlines, discipline and process, yet flexible and pragmatic within a growing business;                          Capable of working autonomously or with a team, and of balancing own initiative with advice from others;                          Able to navigate through complex problems and organisations to achieve results and deliver solutions;                          Able to communicate complex issues to non experts                          Experience of USGAAP (preferred)                          Demonstrable experience of insurance products sold by MetLife globally being a distinct advantage;                          A thorough knowledge of actuarial reporting across a wide range of product types: unit linked; creditor, individual protection and group business;
column11: Computer science, Automation, Data validation, Actuarial, Asset management, IFRS, Financial services, Balance Sheet, Monitoring, Auditing

column2: About the team: The Controllership at Flipkart is responsible to implement strong controls ensuring high quality financial reporting and analysis. Controllership team plays an important role as finance business partner supporting their strategic decision making with inputs on compliance and reporting. Team is embarking on digital transformation journey to enhance efficiency and further enhance controls. Some of the challenging problems we are trying to solve: Drive more leakage improvements Digitization and automations Regular financial reviews to improve quality, improve accuracy of forecast. Drive insights with the business to improve timeliness of reporting About the role The individual will be responsible for Financial reporting and Analysing for Financials Pack, Seller reconciliation and monthly/quarterly reporting. Liaison with business of different project to drive working capital and PL goodness. What youll do: Oversee month-end, quarter-end, and year-end closing activities, including journal entry preparation, account reconciliations, and financial statement analysis. Controlling the GL activities by scrutinizing the ledger accounts periodically and ensure GAAP compliance and adherence to the Corporate Policies. Assist in the development and implementation of accounting policies and procedures to strengthen internal controls and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements. Prepare and analyze financial reports and variance explanations for management review. Support external audit requirements by providing requested documentation and explanations, and resolving audit findings in a timely manner. Manage fixed asset accounting, including capitalization, depreciation, and impairment testing. Assist with special projects and initiatives as assigned by senior management. Stay informed about changes in accounting standards and regulations, and ensure compliance with new requirements. Working with Bizfin/FP&A and business to drive WC optimization and PL goodness Review AP/AR areas of shared services What youll need: Qualified CA with 3 to 4years of post qualification experience in GL accounting role Thorough understanding of GAAP principles and financial reporting requirements Good exp or knowledge of IFRS Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle) and proficiency in Microsoft Excel Knowledge of Power BI (desirable) Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a high attention to detail. Skills Required : Accounting, General Ledger, IFRS, GAAP principles, Consolidation Education/Qualification : CA Desirable Skills : Sound technical knowledge , good communication skills , ability to navigate through ambiguity
column11: GL Accounting, SAP, Power BI, Accounting, GAAP, financial reporting, General Ledger, IFRS, Oracle

column2: Compliance Manager - Quantaco - Business Advisory & Taxation Team Talent Formula is a consulting firm that offers outsourced financial and accounting talent to Chartered Accounting firms worldwide. We are currently looking for energetic and talented Year End Accountants to join their Compliance Team. Quantaco is an Australian company that combines bespoke technology and hospitality-focused expertise to deliver innovative, tech-focused accounting services to clients in the Hospitality sector in Australia. Quantaco is part of the PKF International Network which consists of firms with offices in 440 cities and 150 countries world-wide.    Desired Candidate Experience: At least 5 years of experience with a Chartered Accounting Firm. Preparation, reviewing and filing statuary monthly and quarterly returns. Expertise in bookkeeping, preparing financial statements and annual tax returns for multiple clients. Preferably someone who is completing their CA or is a CA Inter, but not essential. Have the drive to progress within the firm. Has worked directly with clients and stakeholders. Most importantly demonstrate excellent communication skills and a positive attitude. Experience with Australian accounting, taxation and clients is essential. Excellent attention to detail. Strong commitment to quality service and client relationships. Ability to work as a team member. Role Accountabilities:   The role will entail ensuring tasks and deliverables are met on a daily basis in an efficient, timely and accurate manner. These tasks include but are not limited to: Preparation of monthly Management and Analytic reports. Preparation of annual financial statements and tax returns for a range of clients and entities. Companies, Partnerships, Trusts, Sole Traders and Personal. Bookkeeping. Payroll. Preparation and auditing of work papers substantiating Financial Statement balances. Preparation of tax effect accounting calculations. Reviewing taxation notices and preparing correspondence to clients. Liaising with various providers and statutory authorities on behalf of clients. Preparing detailed working paper files including investment, income and CGT reconciliations. Ensuring jobs are completed effectively by meeting technical standards and deadlines. Ensuring clients are made aware of their compliance obligations. Preparation, review and filing of statuary monthly and quarterly returns, including FBT, GST, IAS and Payroll Tax returns. Assistance in the preparation and analysis of tax related information. Candidates will also be subject to our internal skills test and profile benchmark assessment. How to apply? To be considered for this role, you must complete 3 steps: 1. Apply to this job on Naukri and upload your resume 2. Complete the Skills Tests for this roleYou must follow the link below and complete the testing assessments. The first assessment is a Skills Test, to assess your technical ability and numerical reasoning. 3. Complete the Psychometric Test for this role If you successfully clear the Skills Test, you will be redirected to a Psychometric Test to assess how you think and make decisions. To complete these tests, you must go to  https://es.peoplogicaskills.com/es/quiz?testId=cbe24cc2bf9d152a  and complete the assessments. If you do not complete the assessments then you will not be considered for the role. Note: this role can be based in office or work from home.
column11: Financial Statements, Tax Returns, australian accounting, Monthly Returns, Reconciliation

column1: FinOps Assistant Manager - Immediate Joiners Only**
column2: Work   Experience : 6-9years FinAcct Technologies is an ITEs/BPO company providing high quality flexible BPO services. FinAcct Technologies founded with purpose to enable companies to embrace an exceptional service in finance, accounting, consulting, marketing, Backoffice, IT services, ITeS solutions by leveraging the best stack of an outsourcing partnership that fit their needs. We are looking for talented and enterprising candidates who have strong Corporate Accounting acumen and willingness to learn the unknown and grow with the organization. Whats In It for You: Be a part of the growing and transformation journey. This is the place to learn and enhance your skills while having the chance to work on enterprise level service Industry. Continuous learning and development opportunities to develop with Organization. MNC and US accounting process experience is a mandate. This position will report to FinOps Manager. We are looking for a sharp, experienced creative edge, having critical thinking skills, with a strong desire and tenacity to be part of a growing US based client. You should be an initiative-taker, motivated, with good people skills as well as a positive and flexible approach to problems. The applicant should have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, tight deadline delivery timeline. What We are Looking For : Hands-on experience in leading R2R function for US based Company. Should have experience in QB, US GAAP accounting and Financial Statement preparation. Should be able to lead client meetings, Business review calls. Work with US counterparts in driving key process initiatives. Manage and publish daily, weekly, and monthly performance scorecards. Manage and own the process SLAs agree with client. Able to interpret Financial Statements to help Executive team to make decisions. Conduct, monthly, quarterly, and annual one-on-one with team and perform the year end appraisal and performance management. Should be an Individual contributor. Managing client experience. Team management skills. Subject Matter Expert. Basic   Qualifications: BCom Graduate with 6-9 years of work experience having 3-5 years of team and client management experience. Strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills. Proactive, takes initiative, self-motivated, team player. Strong stakeholder management and interpersonal skills. Extensive understanding of financial trends both within the company and general market patterns. Business acumen, Analytical approach, understanding of general business development and operations. Prior experience in similar BPO/Shared Service Function of MNC. Should have experience in US Accounting. Should have excellent communication skills and client interaction experience. Strong willingness to learn and grow. Should be willing to work in US Shifts. Can join immediately. Should work from Office. Industry : Outsourcing / BFSI / Accounting / Startup Permanent Shift: 5:30 PM to 2:30 AM. Location: Hyderabad, Gachibowli. Notice period: Immediate joiners only.
column11: Team Management, Client Management, R2R, GL, Quick Books, US Accounting

column2: Accounts Manager Job Description      Manager position candidate should have 3-6 yrs experience in Trading firms in the Account department capable to run independently and Verify /  analyze accounting records, ,  submit the daily report with comments to Management ,  Prepare the financial statements,  to assess accuracy,  having knowledge in VAT,  TDS,  issue of Way bills and C form etc,  having good command on Compute,  filing the e returns,  ensuring compliance with payment,  reporting or other tax requirements,  Managing transactions with the bank and branch operations. Managing the Team. who want to grow with the company. should have good communication skills.  Prepares asset,  liability,  and capital account entries by compiling and analyzing account information. Responsible for all Tax Compliances such as TDS,  Sales Tax VAT,  Income Tax etc.  Documents financial transactions by entering account information. Recommends financial actions by analyzing accounting options. Design the MIS,  being a team leader will to take responsibility entire account department.  Summarizes current financial status by collecting information; preparing balance sheet,  profit and loss statement,  and other reports. Maintains accounting controls by preparing and recommending policies and procedures. Prepare the worked flow chart,  norms for entire department and take the responsibility to implement at all levels.  Reconciles financial discrepancies by collecting and analyzing account information. Secures financial information by completing data base backups. Maintains financial security by following internal controls. Prepares payments by verifying documentation,  and requesting disbursements. Answers accounting procedure questions by researching and interpreting accounting policy and regulations. keeping financial information confidential. Accomplishes the result by performing the duty. Liaison with internal departments,  auditors and tax consultants.    Salary: Not Disclosed by Recruiter  Industry: Retail /  Wholesale  Functional Area: Finance Accounting Budgeting,  Tax ,  Company Secretary ,  Audit Financial MIS Tally / Focus ERP , VAT Consolidation ,  way bills,  C forms etc  Role Category: Accounts  Role: Accounts Manager  Education-UG: B.Com PG:MBA/ PGDM,  CA Doctorate:Any Doctorate - Any Specialization,  Any Specialization,  Doctorate Not Required

column2: Company Description KMK Ventures is a leading Outsourced Accounting & Tax solutions company providing services to clients based out of USA. Our team of over 475+ professionals including qualified certified public accountants (USA), chartered accountants and staff accountants work from our state-of-the-art facilities in Ahmedabad to assist our clients with their day-to-day accounting and tax requirements, payroll management and tax returns preparation for federal and state returns among other services. Our infrastructure includes highly secure offices, advanced technology and a well-trained team which make us best-in-class. We aim to improve our clients' business processes, productivity and profits with our value-added services, including converting fixed to variable costs, 24/7 operations, and lowering operational costs. Role Description KMK Ventures is looking for a full-time Manager/Senior Manager (US Accounting) to join our team in Ahmedabad. As a Manager, you will be responsible for managing a team of professionals who work with clients based out of USA. This is an on-site role at our Ahmedabad facilities. Qualifications Qualified Chartered Accountant, Certified Public Accountant (US), or other qualified professionals in the accounting field Minimum of 6 years of experience in accounting with at least 3+ years in a managerial role Excellent knowledge of US Accounting and taxation laws and practices Strong communication and leadership skills Manage a team of accountants and ensure accurate financial statements. Proficiency in QuickBooks, Xero, or other accounting software Experience in managing and training team members Certification such as CPA, CMA, or ACCA would be a plus

To coordinate with the bankers of the company to ensure that the limits and the documentation of the company?? financial facilities are well maintained, and the bank facilities are used properly and efficiently. 6. column2: Job DescriptionFinance and Accounts Manager  -  Non IT Jobs    7 years    Best in Industry     ChennaiThe Finance and Accounts Manager will be responsible for monthly closing & reporting (includes preparation of account reconciliations and monthly G / L journal entries) for Indian co and US co   Position  :     Permanent   Location  :     Chennai   Salary  :    Best in Industry   Job Details :    Job Title :  Finance and Accounts Manager   Location :  Chennai   Type :  Full - time   Experience :  7 years in a professional services firm ,  management consulting firm or IT services company   Qualifications :  C.A  / ICWA  /  MBA Finance   Reports to :  Executive Director &Co - Founder   About the Company :     Our client is a fast - growing policy research and development analytics firm focusing on strengthening the use of data and social science research to solve development and inclusive growth issues worldwide. They lie at the intersection of the public and private sectors ,  helping policymakers and development sector actors design data - backed policies and programs.   Job Responsibilities :    Responsible for monthly closing & reporting (includes preparation of account reconciliations and monthly G / L journal entries) for Indian co and US co   Implement the budgeting & forecasting system for the group companies  -  CAPEX & OPEX   Support top management in Strategic Business Planning & Pricing Strategies   Co - ordinate in completion of statutory & tax audits and filing Income Tax Return of the company.   Statutory Compliance :  Management (Income Tax ,  GST ,  FEMA ,  Companies Act ,  PF & PT) & Liaison with Departmental Officials; Efficiency to handle statutory notices and coordinate with the consultants.   Automate processes & introduce Improvements to optimize execution time for routine tasks   Introducing SOP's in finance & accounting  -  maintain a documented system of accounting policies and procedures.   Co - ordinating with business development and operations team to optimize the tax structuring for overseas projects   Support practice leads  /  project managers in monitoring practice / project expenses ,  tracking revenue billing timelines ,  preparing practice / project based P&L   Liaison with bankers for better credit terms ,  monitoring the credit balances consistently to minimize the interest cost for the company.   Tracking exchange rate movements and liaisoning with bankers for beneficial foreign exchange rates   Fund management between accounts in India and US cos   Preparing 6 to 9 - month Cash Flow Forecasts for India and US cos at a weekly level   Administering the travel policy in coordination with Admin   Ensuring reconciliation of bills submitted by vendors with the underlying supporting documentation.   Tracking project travel and ensure the expenditures are within project budgets.   Reviewing and approving travel bills submitted by employees & ensuring compliance with Travel Policy.   Analyze financial performance against key business metrics and document pertinent financial highlights that will enable management to determine progress against budgets.Other tasks as directed from time to time   Skills Required :    Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a multi - disciplinary team setting in a fast -  paced environment (verbal and written)   Strong understanding of Accounting Software   Able to connect with people and collaborate with key stakeholders effectively   Ability to perform under pressure and meet deadlines   Attention to detailWe are looking for team members ,  not mere employees ,  who share their passion for excellence and want to participate in the process of building a great company. We offer an enabling environment where individuals are encouraged to take on responsibility and build a steep career track.

column1: Order To Cash Operations New Associate
column2: Skill required:  Order to Cash - Billing Processing Designation:  Order to Cash Operations New Associate Qualifications: BCom  Years of Experience: 0 to 1 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.Optimizing working capital, providing real-time visibility and end-to-end management of revenue and cash flow, and streamlining billing processes. This team over looks the entire processes that starts from customers inquiry, sales order to delivery and invoicing. The Cash Application Processing team focuses on solving queries related to cash applications and coordination with the customers. The role requires a good understanding of cash applications, the process of applying unapplied cash, reconciliation of suspense account in cash application, and process them from payment receipt to finalization.The Billing Processing team focuses on the process of creating and issuing customer invoices. This includes reviewing the list of debit notes raised and identifying any gaps in the process. The role requires a good understanding of invoicing, collections, account receivables, order management, sales order, order processing, order fulfillment, and journal entries. The role may also require following up with the sales team to provide reasons for raising debit notes and un-recognized revenue. What are we looking for? Ability to work well in a team Results orientation Agility for quick learning Ability to establish strong client relationship Ability to perform under pressure  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your primary interaction is within your own team and your direct supervisor In this role you will be given detailed instructions on all tasks The decisions that you make impact your own work and are closely supervised You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team with a predetermined, narrow scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BCom

column2: Position:  Manager, Finance and Accounting Advisory Services (FAAS) Business Unit:  Consulting  Location:  Ahmedabad, India Employment type:  FTE, Work from Office  This open position is for Armanino India LLP, which is located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India. Armanino India LLP is a fully owned subsidiary of Armanino LLP (USA). Our CFO Advisory Services team helps our clients scale for growth and manage significant business transactions. We combine our depth of technical and business consulting expertise to help meet our clients strategic goals. Were looking for a hardworking, self-starter to join the  Armaninos CFO Advisory team. This is the perfect position for someone who enjoys being a trusted advisor to clients, is a resourceful self-starter and wants to join a fast-paced and challenging environment. Job Responsibilities  Financial Planning and Analysis, including forecasting, budgeting, and preparation of pro-forma financial information Provide technical expertise for  US GAAP and SEC requirements including accounting research, documentation, and presentation to clients  Prepare accurate external financial reports to client, auditors, or the SEC, including the      preparation, review, submission, and distribution of periodic financial reports, such as 10-K, 10-Q, 8Ks and proxy statements Assist in the in the design and implementation of new accounting policies and procedures Assess and improve financial accounting close process, including accelerating and streamlining monthly and quarterly reporting processes Liaison on behalf of the client with external auditors and internal decision makers to assist with Audit preparation Assist with Cash to Accrual Accounting after a transaction, Opening Balance Sheet preparation and Purchase Accounting Lead and manage projects while coordinating directly with clients Foster proactive working relationships with clients and cross-functional departments Make timely and effective performance feedback and training  Requirements  Bachelors Degree in Accounting, Finance, business-related field or related discipline, or equivalent work experience    Minimum  4-7 years ofexperience working in a public accounting firm, consulting firm, or operational accounting role A strong and up-to date knowledge of US GAAP (exposure to      IFRS is a plus), with deep technical understanding of topics such as ASC 606 revenue recognition, lease transactions, purchase accounting, etc. and  experience within the technical accounting or SEC reporting team of a company is a plus Strong analytical and accounting skills  Excellent communication skills  Ability to set priorities and with excellent time management skills; enjoy working independently or in a team environment with clear deadlines and deliverables  Proficiency in MS Office, including Word, Excel, and Outlook  Preferred Qualifications  CA or CPA candidateisdesirable Compensation and Benefits Compensation: Commensurate with Industry standards  Other Benefits:  Provident Fund, Gratuity, Medical Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance etc. employment benefits depending on the position. Armanino India LLP provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. Armanino India LLP complies with applicable labor laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the firm has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall,transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.   Armanino India LLP expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

column2: We are looking for a proactive, trustworthy & high in integrity Finance professional who is well versed in handling the finance functions and other related tasks. We require a Finance and Accounts Manager to help us in managing finance, accounting, tax & compliance, payroll, managing account receivables and payables.      Studio Mosaic is an award-winning, growth-oriented mobile app marketing agency that helps appreneurs & enterprises launch and promote their mobile apps worldwide. We specialize in user acquisition and revenue generation for app-based businesses and have worked with over 300 clients on over 600 app projects till date.      Having consistently been recognized as one of the best app marketing agencies in the world, by Clutch.co, BusinessofApps and others, Studio Mosaic has become the preferred partner for mobile app businesses that want to achieve growth through an ethical and data-driven approach.      Some of our clients include - Sony, Yatra, 3M, HCL along with many other international apps.      Key Responsibilities      Recording of all the entries, book-keeping and accounting Preparing and maintaining cash flow statements Managing all invoicing and related tasks as per the requirements Revenue tracking and managing collections on a regular basis and reporting the same within      specified timelines. Responsible for GST, TDS, Income tax and other statutory and regulatory compliances Analyzing and processing vendor and other external payments Handling finance related tasks of new employees joining, reimbursements and exit Processing payroll, reporting payroll taxes and ensuring compliance thereof Maintaining accounting controls by designing and recommending internal controls, policies and      procedures Securing financial information by completing database backups Substantiating financial transactions by auditing documents Maintaining financial securities, and abiding by the principles of confidentiality and integrity by      following internal controls Assisting and working with auditors and other external consultants for closing of related tasks Performing basic office management duties as requested.      Required Skills & Competencies      Bachelors and/or Masters degree in Accounts & Finance 3-5 years of proven experience as a Finance and Accounts professional Proficient with Tally and Microsoft Office Applications Excellent financial planning, recording and analytical skills Fluency in English and overall good communication skills.      Trustworthy, dedicated, fun, cheerful and extroverted personality Extremely strong ethics Being technologically savvy and an avid user of mobile apps would be great High level of ownership and a go-getter attitude Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects is important. The incumbent should be able to multi-      task and deliver under pressure The incumbent should be detail oriented and organized At Studio Mosaic, we encourage you to be an independent thinker and self-starter. column2: As an Accounting Manager, you will be responsible for the accounting operations of our rapidly growing company. You will be responsible for providing technical accounting expertise, improvement of accounting processes, and development of a high performing accounting team. You must be a hands-on, roll up your sleeves type of Accounting Manager and should enjoy a fast-paced, start-up environment as well as the demonstrated experience building and developing a team.          Equally important to strong management skills, the individual will embrace change and the task of creating an infrastructure to support future growth as the Company expands. Particularly important traits and skills include a high level of integrity, curiosity, intelligence, logical thinking, ability to prioritize, and enthusiasm for change. This position will own all of accounting, including revenue recognition, general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, taxes, treasury services, equity and consolidation.                  Responsibilities:             Oversee all aspects of financial accounting at the Company, including financial procedures and controls, financial period close, and financial statement preparation and analysis.         Oversee the Companys banking relationships, including cash management. Manage the relationship with external auditors and consultants.         Oversee US and international tax compliance.         Ensure that all regulatory reporting requirements are met.         Provide adequate structure and discipline around internal controls.                   Qualifications:             5+ years of progressive, relevant experience with a start-up/ public company. CPA license preferred.          Experience working with legal entities outside of the US preferred; SaaS/SW subscription experience a plus.         Strong working knowledge of U.S. GAAP and key principles of application for a wide array of finance and accounting areas; experience with ASC606 evaluation and adoption a plus.         Advanced MS Excel, Quickbooks are critical; experience with SFDC a plus.         Exceptional work ethic - ability to roll up sleeves .

column2: Job Title:  Manager Finance & Accounts  Experience:  8+ Years Plus Qualification: B Com / M Com / Semi Qualified Skills:  Tally, MS Office Note: This is Urgent requirement, candidate who can join within 30 days prefered. About Company:  Our client is a reliable Pan India, Solution Provider in the field of Mining, Construction and Infrastructure since 1997, specialized in the sales and UPKEEP of construction, mining equipment and drilling systems. It has been partnering KENNAMETAL (USA) for the last 23 years. KENNAMETAL is the world pioneer in drilling tools, construction and mining equipment. Join our dynamic team and take on a leadership role in shaping the financial landscape of our organization. Your experience and expertise will contribute to the financial success and growth of our company. Job Description: As a Manager Finance with over 8 years of experience, you will be responsible for overseeing critical financial functions and ensuring the effective management of financial resources within the organization. Key Responsibilities: Finalization of Accounts: Lead the finalization of accounts, ensuring accuracy and compliance with accounting standards. Bank Reports Submission: Prepare and submit reports to banks, including FFR 1 and 2, and CMA data. Financial Statements: Prepare comprehensive financial statements, providing insights into the financial health of the organization. Taxation: Oversee both Direct and Indirect taxation, ensuring compliance with applicable laws. Tax Audit Report: Prepare and submit tax audit reports, ensuring accuracy and adherence to regulatory requirements. TDS Returns Filing: Manage the filing of TDS returns, staying up-to-date with changes in TDS regulations. Ledger Accounts Scrutiny: Conduct a meticulous scrutiny of ledger accounts, identifying and rectifying discrepancies. Treasury Function: Manage the treasury function, optimizing cash flow and ensuring efficient utilization of financial resources. Preferred candidate profile   Qualifications and Skills: Masters degree in Commerce (M.Com) or MBA in Finance. 8 years or more of relevant experience in financial management. Proficiency in Tally ERP and Microsoft Office is essential. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent understanding of Direct and Indirect taxation laws. Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and compliance.

column1: Senior Accountant - For Professional Consulting Firm
column2: KRISHAN LAL SWAMI AND ASSOCIATES,   EXECUTIVE SEARCH CONSULTANTS, MUMBAI (Hiring for: A Confidential Client -  A Well-Established National Level Firm of Chartered   Accountants with Longstanding Reputation of  over 90 years, having H.O. at  at Worli, Mumbai, and a Pan-India Network of Branches)    Career Opportunity For:   SENIOR ACCOUNTANT  at M. M. Nissim & Co., A Reputed CA Firm, at Worli, Mumbai   Candidates Profile:   Minimum B.Com graduate. Additional qualification in M. Com/CA Inter would be preferred. Candidate should have a minimum of 5 to 6 years experience in Financial Accounting, and Tax Compliance (TDS, and GST, etc.); and should be proficient in Tally ERP 9, MS Excel, and Word. Should have good Communication skills, and have a good and stable professional track record. Experience of working at large CA firm, or other professional service firm would be beneficial.  Job Description: Handling day to day Financial Accounting, and Books of Accounts in Tally. Independently Monitoring and Analyzing Accounting/Financial Data; and Preparing Analytical MIS/Management Reports for management review and decision making. Preparing periodic Financial Statements (Profit & Loss a/c, Balance Sheet); and Finalization of Accounts.  Clients Billing, follow-up for collections, and monitoring Accounts Receivables. Handling Employees Salary - Preparation of Employees Salary data, Payroll Processing, and Payment of Salaries to employees in coordination with HR team for sizeable manpower including for HO, branches, and field staff spread across India. Examination, and Reimbursements of Employees expenses. Verification, Processing, and Payment of Vendors Bills; and monitoring and controlling Accounts Payables. Planning, preparing and managing Cashflow in consultation with Senior Partners; and dealing with Banking matters including Online Remittances/NEFT/RTGS etc.  Timely Statutory Payments; and Statutory Compliances (including Filing of Returns) with regard to:         a. Employees Taxation        b. TDS         c. Income Tax/Advance Tax         d. GST         e. PT, and others laws, as applicable   Other Finance/Accounting/Administrative work as may arise and/or assigned by management from time to time.  Remuneration:  As per the industry standards and based on the experience. Note:  Candidates interested in long term career with M.M. Nissim & Co. LLP would have ample avenues for professional development and growth at the firm.  About Our Client  Our esteemed confidential client,  is a well-established professional firm of Practising Chartered Accountants ( Firm ) with longstanding reputation of  over 90 years.  The Firm has evolved though its long journey, adapting itself to meet the present & future challenges of the profession through experience & development of skills. The Firm has its  Head Office at Worli, Mumbai;  and Regional/ Branch Offices  at New Delhi, Kolkata, Chennai, Bangalore, and also in the states of Gujarat, Haryana, Odisha, and Uttar Pradesh. Over the years the Firms partners??strength has grown to  16 partners,  who are supported by a full repertoire of qualified professionals and audit/tax staff numbering to ~ 225 nos.  with the requisite technical skills, experience, and knowledge to meet the demanding situation of the profession and the clients. The Firm has the unique combination of partners wherein it combines in it the experience and the knowledge of the profession and the practical problems that industry and business face today. Some of the partners have worked with the industrial enterprises before they came over. Each of the partners has a specialized area of expertise and function. This provides added advantage to our clients and helps them in their business strategy and solutions.    The Firm has necessary registrations with government & regulatory bodies - like the Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG), Reserve Bank of India (RBI), Securities & Exchange Board of India (SEBI), Telecom Regulatory Authority of India, Insurance Regulatory & Development Authority and Forward Market Commission - to meet the requirements for allocation of professional work for the public sector undertakings.  The Firm clientele comprise leading enterprises, both the large corporates in the private sector, as well as the major public sector undertakings, and banks - in myriad of business, including industrial/ manufacturing, banking/BFSI, and other services.  This width and breadth make a very interesting and exciting career for the partners and its personnel at the Firm. The Firm offers to its clients a wide array of services: Services Offered:  ??Audit & Assurance ??Taxation & Representation (Direct & Indirect Taxes)  ?? Corporate Laws ??Project Consultancy & Finance ??Mergers and Amalgamation ??Valuation of Business Enterprise ??Advisory Services ??Business Consultancy  ??Family Office/Business Solutions ?? Audit & Assurance Practice:  ??Statutory Audit ??Internal Audit ??Tax Audit Compliance Audit ??Special Investigative Audit ??Concurrent Audit ??Compliance with IFRS ??Due Diligence ??VAT audit ??Information System Audit ?? The long-standing reputation for skill and excellence has helped the firm to forge ahead in the profession with dedication, integrity and ethical values; and carve out a name for itself. For more details, please visit: http://mmnissim.com/ About Us   We, Krishan Lal Swami and Associates (KLS&A), are an Executive Search firms focused on head-hunting for the top and senior level niche positions, on pan-India basis, for our 75+ clients who are Global MNCs and Top Indian Business Houses. We have been promoted by top level accomplished corporate professionals with more than 70+ man -years of experience in strategy, finance, accounting, tax, legal, HRD, IT, commercial functions. Our founders have worked at the Board of Director level with reputed Indian business houses/ conglomerates having businesses across various sectors; and thus, have good network and contacts in various industries. We have modern infrastructure and a strong team of a dozen + talented search professionals (MBAs from well-known institutes from India and abroad, engineers, cost & management accountants, company secretaries, Ph.D.) with diverse backgrounds, who together have 140+ man -years of experience in corporate sectors/ consulting/ recruitment across a myriad of industry domains. We strive for excelling in our service to all our esteemed clients ??big or small. We are willing to invest in building special resources /infrastructure for the specific needs of our esteemed clients. To learn more about us\, please visit: http://www.klsanda.com/

column2: A Key Accounts Manager is responsible for managing and nurturing relationships with key clients or customers of a company     Their primary focus is on building long-term partnerships, maximizing customer satisfaction, and driving business growth within the key accounts     Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with the role of a Key Accounts Manager:Relationship Management: Developing strong relationships with key clients by understanding their business needs, goals, and challenges     This involves regular communication, conducting meetings, and building rapport with key stakeholders     Account Development: Identifying opportunities for account growth and expansion within the key accounts     This may involve cross-selling or upselling additional products or services, identifying new business opportunities, and developing strategies to increase revenue and market share     Customer Retention: Ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention within the key accounts     This includes proactively addressing customer concerns, resolving issues, and acting as the primary point of contact for any service-related inquiries or escalations     Strategic Planning: Collaborating with internal teams, such as sales, marketing, and product development, to develop strategic account plans     These plans outline the objectives, strategies, and action steps required to meet customer needs and achieve business goals     Performance Monitoring: Tracking and analyzing key performance metrics and indicators for the key accounts     This includes monitoring revenue growth, customer satisfaction scores, market trends, and competitive activities to identify areas for improvement and develop proactive strategies

column2: The position would be responsible but not limited for the following:-             Prepare and publish within the stipulated time the monthly accounts which are to include consolidated financials, with P&L and BS along with schedules and cash flow.       Prepare the monthly forecasted cash flow and measure the same with actual of corresponding period.     Take ownership of all inventory to include both in quantity and value.      Publish monthly stock statement in Qty and Value terms.               Get periodic monthly quarterly stock audit performed in all the business units.   Critically evaluate the product costing and see that the sum of all product cost matches with the corresponding P&L.                  Also if the same needs reconciliation of cost with P&L than the same needs to be routinely prepared.       Monitor both payables and receivables. See that advances as paid are recovered timely               Prepare Annual Business Plan and Rolling Quarterly Budget on time   Ensure that the purchase and sale figures are matched with the GST return and the return is timely filled.       Ensure all statutory payments are made on time such as GST, TDS, PF, etc     GST, VAT, Excise, Customs, Income Tax, etc Refunds if any should be vigorously followed up.     Estimate Advance Tax accurately and ensure timely deposit of the same               Track the Open Purchase Orders for the month. Also analyses the PO register every month and come out with the executive summary                 The Order Book is to be critically evaluated and the orders in hand should be earmarked with the stocks in hand or at the third party.        Value of future revenue should be exhibited clearly.     Ensure that Statutory Audit Tax Audit is carried out by auditors on time               Ensure that adequate insurance is being taken for the assets of the Company and see that all the covenants of the insurers are fully followed.                  Track progress of the Company and review the tasks to be achieved on agreed milestones. Thereafter, bring out the executive summary on a monthly basis wherein critical analysis of the financials. If needed, develop customized reporting modules wherein Company activity is routinely appraised and documented.                 Report on monthly basis for each of the unit, budget burnt, revenue, billing, cash flows, slippages, key milestone achieved as well as achievable.                 Analyze and critically evaluate the pricing and cost model and billing procedure and ensure only correct invoices are raised as per the billing schedule after the through scrutiny of the same and see that its realization comes on time.                 Accurately forecast in the monthly MIS the future revenue, cost, profitability, margin, free cash and manpower utilization.                 Prepare the monthly MIS on the profitability statement, analysis of the cost incurred, comparison with the budget or the forecast with reason for the variance, along with the ageing analysis of the receivables, payables, cash flow statement along with a statement of clear dues from clients.                 On a monthly basis analyze the total manpower cost for individual units and identify the employees on the overhead which needs deployment.       Simultaneously, output of the manpower deployed on the Company to be critically evaluated.      Manage Company budget on a monthly basis and identify the gap with remarks for the variances.                Monitor the Company unit wise production and maximization plan and comment on the progress made each month.       Should be the interface between accounts and the production and other departments               Should strive to arrange, share, assist in any informationissuesdata pertaining to each of the associated departments and endeavor to resolve the long pending issues if any.       Prepare and monitor the statement of indirect cost associated with each of the unit and location.               Preparation of Annual Unit wise Budget along with its forecasted cash flow statement and scheduling of expenditures and revenue should be undertaken on a yearly basis.                 Monitor Key Project KPI and report the same on a monthly basis. Maintain Cost as approved by the management and identify opportunities for cost saving.       Support the management in arranging finance through banks or financial institutions.               Prepare any kind of presentation materials for management reports along with any internal or external ad-hoc reports through data gathering, analyzing, and summarizing the relevant information from the departmentsprojects.       Create or participate in creation of Company documentation, contracts, agreements, MOUs letter of undertaking etc.     Provide training to all concerned.     In discharging the duties to follow Company policies, procedures and methodologies.     Any other duties as may be assigned from time to time. column2: Roles and Responsibilities of Accounts Manager :- A). Preparation of Financial statements: - 1. Streamlining & grouping of Ledgers, P/L and B/S items. 2. TDS deduction of all deductees comes under the purview. 3. Expense Reconciliation. 4. Provisioning of Expense and current liabilities. 5. FD reconciliation and calculation of Interest Accrued. 6. 26AS Reco- TDS receivable. 7. Prepaid Expense - Schedule. 8. Member Income receivable Reco- Adda Application Vs Tally. 9. Preparation of Draft financials for statutory Auditors followed with Notes on Accounts. B). Statutory Compliances: - 1. Identify the invoices which attract TDS, and post in Tally. Remit the amount within the due date of the month. 2. TDS Return filing -Extract data from Tally, prepare calculation sheet with deductee details and upload the data, generate e-filing. 3. Generate Form 16A from Traces using Token number and circulate to deductees. 4. Justification report & Consolidated statement from Traces for Overall TDS Reco. 5. TDS Revision files upload and E-return in case of any changes. 6. GSTR 1 filing- Extract the file from Tally and Adda, Prepare the calculation. Upload the data in offline GST portal, convert into .json file and import into online portal, File the return, and get acknowledgement. 7. Compare GSTR 2A month on month basis, highlight the vendors who are not declaring GST liability. 8. GSTR 3B- Extract the data from Tally and Adda Application, prepare the calculation sheet, find out the GST payable. 10. Pass the transfer entry from Adda Application to Tally. Set off entry to be passed in Tally to arrive GST payable. 11. Calculation of RCM payable. 12. Calculation of Input Reversal as per sec 42/43. 13. Remit GST payable and file the return. 14. Advance Tax Calculation and remittance: A detailed calculation of income tax payable by considering the Incomes and expense for the year. C). Reports: - 1. Inflow Vs Outflow and P/L for the period. 2. Debtors and creditors outstanding Report. 3. BRS of CAM from Adda to Tally (consolidate). D). Banking: - 1. Fund Management- maintaining minimum balance, FD creation etc. 2. Co-ordinate with bank officials in case of any documentation, kyc, signatory updation and prepare the Board resolution or other related letters as and when required. E). Payables: - 1. Review of daybook, Journals and Vouchers. 2. Review of Invoices from Vendors to ensure all statutory compliances are followed. 3. Review the details in tally and release the payments after obtaining approvals from Office Bearers. 4. Make sure all the expenses have been captured in Tally. 5. Keep track of revenue receivables and expense payables. F). Others: - 1. Providing Invoices, reconciliation of PY ledgers or any other information/data related to finance or accounts as and when required by Management. 2. CAM (Maintenance) Rate analysis for quarterly billing -Actual Vs billed 3. CAM (Maintenance) invoicing in Adda Application ??On Quarterly Basis. 4. Sending Reminders to Defaulters. 5. Explanation regarding Interest calculation or GST related queries to residents. 7. Addressing to Mail queries.

column2: Role & responsibilities:   Financial Reporting: Ensure that financial reports are accurate, timely, and relevant, providing insights for informed business decisions and forecasting future financial trends.  Cost Management: Monitor the cost structure, conduct cost analysis, establish planning and control procedures, and analyze variances to optimize cost efficiency.  Financial Close: Oversee the accurate and timely completion of month-end and quarter-end financial close processes, including related party reporting to maintain financial transparency. Compliance Enforcement: Enforce compliance with the client and Operating Company policies, ensuring adherence to regulatory standards and internal controls.  Finance Support: Provide financial support for vendor and procurement management, fixed asset acquisition and management, and offer insights on spending control for both Capital Expenditures (CapEx) and Operating Expenses (OpEx).  Business Partnership: Collaborate with functional heads to provide financial analysis, guidance, and support in aligning financial goals with business objectives.  Compliance Management: Ensure Straight-Through Processing (STP) compliance for transactions and reporting, maintaining accuracy and efficiency in financial operations. Audit Coordination: Support and coordinate with cross-functional teams on statutory and internal audits, as well as Balance Sheet reviews, to ensure financial integrity and compliance with audit requirements. The Manager's critical role in financial management, reporting, compliance, cost control, business support, and audit coordination to drive financial performance and strategic decision-making within the organization. Preferred candidate profile: Experience in various accounting and finance roles required with experience in Statutory compliances, and account reconciliation. Experience reviewing, consolidating, and reporting financial results preferably in the IT industry. Business partnering, working with, and influencing multi-functional teams and stakeholders within the organization. Strong experience working independently, understanding of managing expectations, and dealing with conflict. Previous experience driving alignment and trade-off decisions across the organization through strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Experience in improving Internal Controls, Working capital analysis, and management. Knowledge and practical experience of SAP system. Strong experience working independently. Perks and benefits   What's in it for you ?  Pathways for career development Work with colleagues and clients around the world on interesting and challenging work. We provide internal career opportunities, so you can take your career further within TMF. Continuous development is supported through global learning opportunities from the TMF Business Academy. Making an impact You'll be helping us to make the world a simpler place to do business for our clients. Through our corporate social responsibility program, you'll also be making a difference in the communities where we work. A supportive environment Strong feedback culture to help build an engaging workplace. Our inclusive work environment allows you to work from our offices around the world, as well as from home, helping you find the right work-life balance to perform at your best. Other Benefits Marriage Gift policy Paternity & Adoption leaves Interest-free loan policy Salary advance policy Wellbeing initiatives Interested candidates can share profiles at ankita.dwivedi@tmf-group.com

column2: *Job Description: Manager Finance & Accounts* *Position Overview:* We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Manager Finance & Accounts to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing various financial and accounting tasks, ensuring compliance with regulations, and contributing to the overall financial health of the organization. This role requires strong knowledge of taxation, accounting principles, and excellent interpersonal skills to liaise with various stakeholders. *Key Responsibilities:* 1. *GST Returns (1/3B/Annual Return) - Preparation & Filing:*    - Ensure accurate and timely preparation and filing of GST returns, including GSTR-1, GSTR-3B, and annual returns.    - Stay updated with GST regulations and amendments to ensure compliance. 2. *GST Registrations:*    - Manage the process of GST registrations for the organization as required.    - Ensure timely completion and compliance with all registration requirements. 3. *Dealing with Tax Departments:*    - Act as the primary liaison with tax authorities, handling inquiries, audits, and assessments effectively.    - Maintain a positive relationship with tax departments to facilitate smooth operations. 4. *Balance Sheet Preparation & Finalization:*    - Oversee the preparation and finalization of balance sheets in accordance with accounting standards.    - Ensure accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements. 5. *Tax Audit - Preparation & Filing:*    - Prepare and file tax audit reports, ensuring adherence to statutory regulations.    - Coordinate with auditors and provide necessary documentation for tax audits. 6. *Inter-Company Reconciliations:*    - Manage inter-company reconciliations to ensure accurate financial reporting.    - Resolve discrepancies and discrepancies in a timely manner. 7. *Payroll Checking:*    - Review and verify payroll transactions, ensuring accuracy and compliance with relevant laws and regulations.    - Address any payroll-related queries or issues raised by employees. 8. *Dealing with Banks:*    - Maintain relationships with banks and financial institutions.    - Coordinate banking transactions, including deposits, withdrawals, and loan documentation. 9. *Working Knowledge of ERP:*    - Utilize ERP systems for financial record-keeping, reporting, and analysis.    - Provide training and support to team members on ERP usage as needed. 10. *Other Misc. Works:*     - Undertake ad-hoc financial tasks and projects as assigned.     - Assist in financial analysis, budgeting, and forecasting as required. *Qualifications:* - Qualified Chartered Accountant (CA) or CA Inter with relevant experience. - Strong knowledge of Indian taxation laws, including GST, income tax, and corporate tax. - Proficiency in accounting principles, financial reporting, and auditing standards. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work under pressure to meet deadlines. - Experience with ERP systems and financial software?is?preferred.
