column2: The mission of Komodo's Senior Accounting Manager is to support the growth of the company and its functions through data asset accounting, managing international entities, and other tasks as needed.      This role will report to the Assistant Controller and be an integral piece to the Accounting team as we mature our accounting processes and capabilities.      Our Dragons are diverse and multi-dimensional. we'reflect that belief in our name and in the work we do every day.                  ?       Looking back on your first 12 months at Komodo Health, you will have accomplished          Implement process improvements in data procurement accounting to increase accuracy and efficiency      Establish and maintain robust infrastructure with cross-functional teams for data assets, from procurement to payment      Improve data-related reporting and analysis to senior management and external auditors          You will accomplish these outcomes through the following responsibilities          Evaluate data contracts to ensure proper accounting treatment, including complex arrangements with multiple deliverables and variable pricing structures; and conducting thorough research and documenting conclusions as necessary      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data, Legal, and Finance, to ensure accurate and timely amortization of data assets      Oversee the review and analysis of data vendor contracts to determine appropriate amortization treatment      Manage the month-end and quarter-end close processes related to data asset accounting, including preparation of journal entries and reconciliations      Manage the month-end and quarter-end close processes related to international subsidiaries, including reviewing and preparing journal entries and reconciliations          What you bring to Komodo Health (required):          Bachelors degree in Accounting or Finance      Experience in a large public accounting firm      8+ years of progressive experience in revenue accounting, with a strong understanding of ASC 606 requirements      Knowledge of revenue recognition principles and practices, including experience with complex revenue arrangements      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret and apply technical accounting guidance to real-world scenarios      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate complex financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders      Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and integrity in financial reporting      Strong excel skills and ability to efficiently work with large volumes of data      Proficiency in ERP systems; experience with NetSuite          Additional skills and experience we d prioritize (nice to have)          CA (Chartered Accountant) certification strongly preferred            What We Offer            This position will be eligible for company benefits in accordance with Company policy        We offer a competitive total rewards package including medical, dental and vision coverage along with a broad range of supplemental benefits including 401k Retirement Plan, prepaid legal assistance, and more      We also offer paid time off for vacation, sickness, holiday, and bereavement      We are pleased to be able to provide 100% company-paid life insurance and long-term disability insurance      This information is intended to be a general overview and may be modified by the Company due to business-related factors

column2: Role & responsibilities   GST Filing:  Prepare and file GST returns accurately and on time, ensuring compliance with all applicable regulations. Balance Sheet Preparation:  Compile and analyze financial information to prepare balance sheets, profit and loss statements, and other financial reports. ROC Compliances:  Ensure timely filing of all ROC (Registrar of Companies) returns and compliances. Book-Keeping:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all financial transactions. Invoicing:  Generate and manage invoices, ensuring timely billing and receipt of payments. Regular Accounting:  Perform daily accounting tasks, including reconciliation of accounts, management of accounts payable and receivable, and payroll processing. Payment Advice:  Prepare and send payment advice to vendors and service providers. Debtor/Creditor Management:  Monitor and manage debtor and creditor accounts, ensuring timely collections and payments. Financial Analysis:  Conduct financial analysis and prepare reports to provide insights into financial performance. Audit Coordination:  Assist in coordinating and preparing for internal and external audits. Taxation:  Handle all aspects of direct and indirect taxation, including TDS, income tax, and GST. Compliance:  Ensure compliance with all statutory requirements and company policies. Process Improvement:  Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy in financial operations. Preferred candidate profile   Education:  Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. CA/CPA certification is preferred. Experience:  Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in accounting, with a focus on GST filing, balance sheet preparation, compliance, and debtor/creditor management. Industry Knowledge:  Familiarity with the specific accounting and compliance requirements of the [your industry] industry is a plus. Ethical Conduct:  Demonstrates integrity and ethical conduct in all financial dealings Perks and benefits   Competitive Salary:  Attractive salary package commensurate with experience and qualifications. Health Insurance:  Comprehensive health insurance coverage for employees and their families. Professional Development:  Opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth. Flexible Working Hours:  Flexible working hours to promote work-life balance. Employee Wellness Programs:  Access to wellness programs and initiatives. Paid Time Off:  Generous paid time off and holiday policies. Retirement Benefits:  Contribution to retirement savings plans.

column2: Job Title: Deputy Manager - Accounts Job Description: Seeking for a highly qualified and experienced Chartered Accountant to join our team as Deputy Manager - Accounts. The ideal candidate should possess a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience in various aspects of accounting, with a strong focus on consolidation of accounts, statutory audit, ERP systems, IND-AS, and statutory reporting. Key Responsibilities: Consolidation of Accounts : Lead the consolidation process for the company's financial statements, ensuring accuracy and compliance with relevant accounting standards. Statutory Audit : Coordinate and manage the statutory audit process, liaising with external auditors to ensure timely completion and compliance with regulatory requirements. ERP Systems : Utilize ERP systems effectively to streamline accounting processes, maintain data integrity, and generate accurate financial reports. IND-AS Compliance : Stay updated with the latest developments in accounting standards, particularly IND-AS, and ensure adherence to regulatory requirements in financial reporting. Statutory Reporting : Prepare and submit statutory reports accurately and within deadlines, complying with all legal and regulatory requirements. Financial Analysis : Assist in financial analysis and interpretation of data to support strategic decision-making processes. Team Management : Provide guidance and supervision to junior members of the accounting team, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement. Compliance and Risk Management : Identify potential areas of risk or non-compliance in accounting practices and implement appropriate controls to mitigate risks. Requirements: Qualified Chartered Accountant (CA) with a minimum of 4 years of experience in accounting and finance roles. Strong knowledge and experience in consolidation of accounts, statutory audit, ERP systems, IND-AS, and statutory reporting. Proficiency in using accounting software and ERP systems for financial management and reporting. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex financial data. High level of attention to detail and accuracy in financial reporting. Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments and communicate financial information effectively. Proactive approach to learning and staying updated with changes in accounting standards and regulations. Leadership qualities with the ability to mentor and develop junior team members.
column11: Consolidation, Ind As, Statutory Audit, Financial Analysis, Compliance, Statutory Compliance

column2: Roles & responsibilities:    Financial Planning and Analysis: Develop and implement financial strategies to achieve company goals. Conduct financial analysis, forecasting, and budgeting to guide decision-making. Provide insights and recommendations to senior management based on financial data. Strategic Planning: Contribute to the development and execution of the company's strategic initiatives. Evaluate investment opportunities and assess their financial viability. Accounting Operations: Manage day-to-day accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger. Ensure accurate and timely recording of financial transactions. Oversee payroll processing and tax compliance. Financial Reporting: Prepare and present financial statements, reports, and analysis to senior management and stakeholders. Ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulatory requirements. Coordinate with auditors during external audits. Team Leadership and Development: Supervise and mentor accounting staff, providing guidance and support. Foster a collaborative and high-performance work environment. Conduct performance evaluations and identify training needs. Risk Management: Assess financial risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. Implement internal controls to safeguard company assets and ensure compliance with policies and regulations. Preferred candidate profile:    Possess good communication skill. Proven work experience as an Accounts Manager or  similar role. Strong knowledge of accounting principles and practices. Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel and ERP. Excellent attention to detail and accuracy. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Effective communication and interpersonal abilities. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Familiarity with tax regulations and compliance procedures is a plus.

column2: I) BUDGET & FORECAST     Design effective budget models and scenarios for the Company, Departments,   Investors and Bankers.   Analyze financial information (e.g. revenues, expenditures and cash   management) to ensure all operations are within budget limits.   Review budget requests for approval.   Forecast future budget needs.   Identify variances between actual and budgeted financial results at the end of   every month.   Suggest spending improvements that increase EBITDA.   Review the company s budget for compliance with legal regulations.   Ensure department managers meet budget submission deadlines.   Design and implement effective budgeting policies and procedures.   Understand multiple processes to capture revenues and expenses efficiently in   budgeting.   Work on budget recommendations and developing a final budgetary agreement   with management, present annual budgets to Management.       II) PAYROLL     Responsible for Multiple country payroll for accurate and timely processing   through inhouse team (or third party vendors) for employees in US, India, UK,   Netherlands, France, Singapore, Dubai, etc.   Review employee agreements and work on actionable points wherever needed.   Responsible for creating processes to coordinate with employees, HR and other   team members.   Liaise with HR and other team members to ensure data for the Payroll is 100%   accurate, timely & complete.   Work in collaboration with regionally based payroll vendors to resolve employee s   payroll-related questions.   Help in international payroll related regulatory and compliance filings.   Keeps abreast of the payroll processing system and changes in wage/tax laws,   and applies changes as appropriate.   Financial Reporting from payroll outputs (monthly accounting journal, employee   detail report).   Responsible for any other task that is related to Employee Pay.     III) ADHOC PROJECTS     Participate in special projects and other duties as assigned.   Reports that are separately required by Management other than what is   mentioned above w.r.t running day to day business.             Who You Are:     Masters Degree in Accounts / Finance or closely related field. CA/CA Inter   Preferable.   5-7 years of experience out of which must have minimum 2 year experience in   budgeting, financial reporting and financial systems.   Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap   to success and the action it takes to make it happen.   Proven ability to prioritize projects and meet deadlines.   Knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods.   An analytical mind with a problem-solving attitude.   Demonstrate a detail-orientation and thoroughness to assignments and a high   degree of accuracy.   Hands-on experience with accounting software and statistical packages.   Knowledge of MS Excel (specifically, advanced formulas, pivot tables and   charts).

Stay informed about Salesforce best practices, updates, and new features, and assess their potential impact on our organization's Salesforce implementation.

column2: Account   Manager  Construction Must have worked with a private general contracting firm in an earlier role and must have experience in pre-contracts for commercial, residential & industrial buildings. An Account Manager in a construction company plays a vital role in managing relationships with clients and ensuring their needs are met in a timely and satisfactory manner. This position involves a combination of sales, customer service, project management, and strategic planning. Below is a detailed job description for an Account Manager in the construction industry: Experience  10 + years (Constrution firm) Qualification Civil Engineering or equivalent Location Pune Job Summary: The Account Manager is responsible for nurturing long-term relationships with customers and overseeing sales. As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for finding new business opportunities and managing customer satisfaction. Your goal will be to help us safeguard our revenue and retain our customers. Key Responsibilities: Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships. Act as the main point of contact and manage individual accounts. Handle client issues throughout the lifecycle of the project. Project Coordination: Collaborate with project teams to ensure that contractual commitments are met. Coordinate with internal departments (e.g., project management, legal, finance) to ensure client needs are addressed. Sales and Business Development: Develop trusted advisor relationships with key accounts, customer stakeholders, and executive sponsors. Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives. Financial Management: Negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profits. Develop new business with existing clients and identify areas of improvement. Reporting and Analysis: Prepare reports on account status and keep current client records and data up to date. Monitor sales performance metrics. Market Insight: Identify industry trends and client needs, providing feedback to the company on market and creative trends. Required Skills and Qualifications: Proven work experience as an Account Manager, Key Account Manager, Sales Account Manager, Junior Account Manager, or relevant role. Demonstrable ability to communicate, present, and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level. Solid experience with CRM software and MS Office (particularly MS Excel). Experience delivering client-focused solutions to customer needs. Proven ability to manage multiple account management projects at a time while maintaining sharp attention to detail. Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation abilities. Strong verbal and written communication skills. BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Sales, or relevant field. Working Conditions: Typically office-based but may require visits to client sites and occasional travel as needed. Regular hours with additional hours to meet project deadlines or client needs. Salary: The salary for an Account Manager can vary based on location, experience, and the size of the company. Compensation packages often include a combination of base salary and performance-based incentives. Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: This is a earthing materials manufacturing unit .Only male candidate can apply.          Qualification:        B Com/ M Com            Work Experience:        6 to 10 Years            Required Skills:        Basic computer knowledge                    ?       As a Senior Accounts Manager, your role is to oversee and manage the accounting department of an organization. You are responsible for ensuring the accuracy of financial records, implementing and maintaining accounting policies and procedures, and providing financial analysis and guidance to support the organization's financial objectives. Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with being a Senior Accounts Manager:      Financial Management: You oversee the organization's financial activities, including budgeting, financial reporting, and analysis. You ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial records, monitor cash flow, and manage financial risks.      Accounting Operations: You supervise and manage the day-to-day accounting operations, such as accounts payable, accounts receivable, general ledger, and payroll. You ensure that transactions are recorded accurately and in compliance with accounting standards.      Financial Reporting: You prepare and analyze financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements. You provide regular financial reports and insights to senior management, highlighting key performance indicators and financial trends.      Compliance and Audit: You ensure compliance with accounting standards, regulations, and internal policies. You coordinate and oversee internal and external audits, providing necessary documentation and explanations to auditors.      Taxation: You manage tax-related matters, including tax planning, compliance, and filing of tax returns. You stay updated with tax regulations and ensure the organization's compliance with tax laws.      Financial Analysis and Planning: You conduct financial analysis to support decision-making and strategic planning. This includes analyzing financial data, identifying trends, and providing insights and recommendations to senior management.      Team Management: If applicable, you manage and mentor a team of accountants or financial professionals. You provide guidance, support professional development, and ensure efficient workflow and productivity within the department.
